name: Mateja Jamnik
content: Mateja Jamnik I am a full Professor of Artificial Intelligence in the Department of Computer Science and Technology (Computer Laboratory) at the University of Cambridge, UK. I am also an associate fellow at the Leverhulme Centre for the Future of Intelligence. I serve on the UK Home Office Science Advisory Council and previously as Specialist Adviser to the House of Lords Select Committee on Artificial Intelligence. I founded the women@CL initiative. I am interested in developing AI techniques for human-like computing - in my research I combine AI reasoning with machine learning techniques in order to advance the explainability of AI systems, and apply them to personalised medicine and tutoring systems. Broadly, my research is in the areas of artificial intelligence, human-like computation, machine learning, explainability, automated reasoning, diagrammatic reasoning, knowledge representation, theorem proving, cognitive science, and human-computer interaction. Some research projects: explainability methods for deep learning, integrating symbolic methods with neural machine learning (including LLMs) for reasoning (AI for math), human adaptable knowledge representations for AI systems, multi-modal machine learning, tabular foundation models. My talk on AI I was Specialist Adviser to the House of Lords Select Committee on AI: the report Mateja Jamnik Computer Laboratory The University of Cambridge JJ Thomson Avenue Cambridge, CB3 0FD, UK Phone: +44 (0)1223 763 587 Email: Mateja dot Jamnik at cl dot cam dot ac dot uk News. 2025-26 Student project suggestions UKRI AI CDT in Decision Making for Complex Systems awarded. EleutherAI PhD studentship awarded. Won Royal Society Athena Award. Conferences. Diagrams 2026 NeurIPS 2025 AAAI 2025 ICLR 2025 ICML 2025 IJCAI 2025 Links.
